text: The First Reception Service consists of a number of initial training and information activities especially designed for its users. It includes counselling, initial adult training, and certification of basic skills and competences to make living and working in Catalonia easier. There are three different modules. Module A. Languages, which consists of a 90 hour Catalan and 90 hour Spanish course. Module A is offered at Col-legi Sagrat Cor. Module A is given on Fridays and Mondays from 00 to 00. Module B. Labour market knowledge, which consists of a 15 hour course on Labour Market and Employment. Module B is offered at City Council Building. Module B is given on Wednesdays from 00 to 00. Module C. Catalan Society, which consists of a :hasNumberHours: hour course on :hasCourseName:. Module C is offered at City Council Building. Module C is given on Wednesdays from 00 to 00. You can take each module separately and you have 2 years to complete them all.     A module is completed if you attend, at least 75% of the classes. In case you can speak and understand Catalan or Spanish or you have a certificate proving that you already completed a course, you wonâ€™t have to take that specific module. If you apply, you will have access to a set of basic tools that will help you become part of the Catalan society. The certificate can also be useful for job search as an added value to your skills and experience. Furthermore, the Reception Certificate could be used in legal immigration requirements like social ties, modification and/or renewal of residence authorizations, among others.
